alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 28 at 6:59PM MST until June 28 at 10:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Yavapai County in west central Arizona... * Until 1000 PM MST. * At 655 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area in southwest Yavapai County from Kirkland and Skull Valley west to the Mohave County line just south of Bagdad. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Yava, Kirkland and Skull Valley. This includes the following highways... Highway 93 between mile markers 149 and 168. State Route 97 between mile markers 156 and 166. State Route 96 between mile markers 4 and 21. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Sycamore Creek, Kirkland Creek, Iron Spring Wash, South Fork Santa Maria River, Santa Maria River, Bridle Creek, Skull Valley Wash, North Fork Date Creek, Cottonwood Creek, Loco Creek and Little Shipp Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
